intro: Urostachys mollicomus, commonly known as the soft-haired grass veldt, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features slender, wiry stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are soft and hairy, contributing to its common name, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Urostachys mollicomus is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
